body_html:
These strip args are in the rule for the final
.so file tho so isnt this only at the end?

I have not seen any size or ram issues from users on gentoo with this patch so far.

If size issues are a problem tho, bazel has a --strip=always which would strip every binary along the way which would probably be even better than the -s for these two .so's.

I have no issue with some other way as long as there is a way it can be toggled off since otherwise our package manager throws huge QA warnings

body:
These strip args are in the rule for the final 
.so file tho so isnt this only at the end?

I have not seen any size or ram issues from users on gentoo with this patch so far. 

If size issues are a problem tho, bazel has a --strip=always which would strip every binary along the way which would probably be even better than the -s for these two .so's.

I have no issue with some other way as long as there is a way it can be toggled off since otherwise our package manager throws huge QA warnings
